description: This whirlwind introduction comprehensively examines foundational principles, theoretical
approaches, and major areas of study within psychology. Acting as skeptical scientists, students
gain another lens on the human experience by which they can better understand themselves and
Students see psychology as a science and challenge "common sense" explanations about how people
function. This gateway course captures the essence of the liberal arts, applying to almost any
career choice. Offered each semester. Also counts toward nursing, social studies
education, and social work majors and educational studies concentration.
